title: It is a known fact that if all forms of life, plant and animal, within the universe ceased to exist that the universe will still exist for billions of years. Therefore is the universe really about itself or about the life that's in it? - Quora

response.answer_text: The universe doesn’t care whether there’s anyone to observe it or not. We might be the only planet with life, for all we know, and once all life on Earth ceases in a few billion years, the universe will be there, and continuing to expand. On the other side, the universe existed for billions of years before there even was a planet called Earth, and it did just fine before we came along as well.

A2A: You are trying to put human interpretation on the universe. Whatever you mean by “being about” something, having a “purpose” is a human interpretation. The universe just is.
